channel.title: I broke python
channel.description:
I'm running arch linux 3.whatever the newest kernel is.
So after upgrading my system (in which i may have deleted some files to force it to work), wicd, which I use to connect to my wireless network has stopped working. I get a variety of errors (depending on if i launch the gtk, curses or cli versions of the program), about gobject, dbus and gtk modules not being present.
I have both python (python3.3) and python2 (python2.7) installed, but afaik wicd relies on 2.7. There have been loads of conflicts with the two versions and I believe I've done something that's borked them :(
I've tried re-installed wicd, dbus, python (both verisons) and it's dependencies, to no avail.
I'd like to think that to solve this I need to remove python [b]completely[/b] and then reinstall but pacman -R python isn't very useful.
Any input would be great.

item.title: I broke python
item.dc:creator: @light-232 light-232
item.description:
@light-232 wrote:

remove python with its dependencies,
pacman -Rs pkg_name

Read full topic

item.title: I broke python
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

isn’t python 3’s symlink titled as python3 and python 2.x python?

Read full topic
